Package com.example.matata

Class DatePickerFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
com.example.matata.DatePickerFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.app.DatePickerDialog.OnDateSetListener, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class DatePickerFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment implements android.app.DatePickerDialog.OnDateSetListener
The DatePickerFragment class represents a dialog fragment that displays a date picker dialog.

This class allows users to select a date from a calendar-style picker. The selected date is communicated back to the host activity, which is expected to implement the DatePickerListener interface. This makes it suitable for scenarios requiring date input, such as event scheduling or setting reminders.

The class is designed to be lightweight and reusable. It sets the default date to the current system date when initialized.

Key Features:

  • Displays a customizable date picker dialog.
  • Handles date selection through a callback interface.
  • Ensures default initialization to the current date.

Usage:

 public class MainActivity extends AppCompatActivity implements DatePickerListener {
     ...
     void showDatePicker() {
         DialogFragment datePickerFragment = new DatePickerFragment();
         datePickerFragment.show(getSupportFragmentManager(), "datePicker");
     }

     @Override
     public void onDateSelected(int year, int month, int date) {
         // Handle the selected date
     }
 }

Outstanding Issues:

  • No validation is performed to ensure the host activity implements the DatePickerListener interface, which could lead to a runtime exception.
  • The selected date is directly passed to the host activity without additional formatting or validation.

  • Method Details

    • onCreateDialog

      @NonNull public android.app.Dialog onCreateDialog(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Initializes and returns a DatePickerDialog set to the current date.

      This method retrieves the current system date using Calendar and uses it to set the initial values for the date picker.

      Overrides:
      onCreateDialog in class androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
      Parameters:
      savedInstanceState - A Bundle containing the saved state of the dialog fragment, if any.
      Returns:
      A DatePickerDialog instance initialized with the current date.

    • onAttach

      public void onAttach(@NonNull android.content.Context context)
      Attaches the fragment to a context.

      This method is part of the fragment lifecycle and is invoked when the fragment is associated with a host activity or another context. It can be overridden to perform additional setup operations, such as verifying the host context.

      Overrides:
      onAttach in class androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
      Parameters:
      context - The Context to which the fragment is being attached, typically the host activity.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the host activity does not implement DatePickerListener.

    • onDateSet

      public void onDateSet(android.widget.DatePicker datePicker, int year, int month, int date)
      Callback method invoked when the user selects a date in the date picker.

      This method passes the selected year, month, and day of the month to the host activity through the DatePickerListener.onDateSelected(int, int, int) callback. The month value is zero-based, meaning January is represented as 0, February as 1, and so on.

      Example: 

       @Override
 public void onDateSelected(int year, int month, int date) {
     String selectedDate = String.format("%02d/%02d/%04d", date, month + 1, year);
     textView.setText(selectedDate);
 }
      Specified by:
      onDateSet in interface android.app.DatePickerDialog.OnDateSetListener
      Parameters:
      datePicker - The DatePicker view used to select the date.
      year - The year selected by the user.
      month - The zero-based month selected by the user.
      date - The day of the month selected by the user.
